{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "IT Officer / Manager",
  "description": "Dunn And Braxton Limited&nbsp;-&nbsp;Our client is a retail store that sells home goods, furniture, gift items, and d&eacute;cor products. They company are seeking to hire an experienced candidate to provide technical support across the store(s), ensure all IT systems, equipment, and networks operate smoothly, support staff with day-to-day technical issues, maintain critical retail systems such as tills, handheld devices, self-checkout machines, and back-office systems, also help implement new technologies.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Officer / Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Part-time
Work Schedule: Monday &ndash; Saturday: 8 am to 6 pm

Key Responsibilities


	System and Database Administration.
	Manage Website.
	Software installation, configuration, database backup and restore/recovery maintenance.
	Windows operating System maintenance and repair.
	Performance of troubleshooting and diagnosis of hardware/software,
	Provision of solution to network failure.
	Any other issues that needs the IT officer&rsquo;s attention.
	Coordinate with procurement and purchasing teams to place orders for replenishment stock, ensuring timely delivery and availability of inventory items.
	Support inventory and stock management systems, ensuring smooth operation
	Develop and implement effective social media strategies including to create, curate, and manage engaging content across all social media platforms.
	Monitor, listen, and respond to users in a positive and professional manner.Manage social media advertising campaigns to drive targeted traffic and sales.
	Track and report on social media performance and ROI.
	Any other assigned task by the management.


Requirements


	B.Sc / HND / OND in IT related course with minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience.
	Experience supporting Windows environments, POS systems, and networked devices.
	Strong knowledge of computer hardware, software, and troubleshooting methods.
	Good understanding of basic networking (Wi-Fi, routers/switches, IP addressing).
	Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure.
	Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues simply.
	Ability to prioritise tasks in a fast-paced retail environment.
	Previous IT support experience in retail or a similar customer-facing environment.
	Familiarity with retail systems such as POS, back-office stock systems, or handheld scanners.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / month

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to:&nbsp;recruitment@dunnandbraxton.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-08",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-18",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Dunn And Braxton Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "192738"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 75000,
      "maxValue": 150000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



IT Officer / Manager Job at Dunn And Braxton Limited




        
    

        
        Dunn And Braxton Limited - Our client is a retail store that sells home goods, furniture, gift items, and décor products. They company are seeking to hire an experienced candidate to provide technical support across the store(s), ensure all IT systems, equipment, and networks operate smoothly, support staff with day-to-day technical issues, maintain critical retail systems such as tills, handheld devices, self-checkout machines, and back-office systems, also help implement new technologies.
     

            
    



They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Officer / Manager
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Part-time
Work Schedule: Monday – Saturday: 8 am to 6 pm

Key Responsibilities


	System and Database Administration.
	Manage Website.
	Software installation, configuration, database backup and restore/recovery maintenance.
	Windows operating System maintenance and repair.
	Performance of troubleshooting and diagnosis of hardware/software,
	Provision of solution to network failure.
	Any other issues that needs the IT officer’s attention.
	Coordinate with procurement and purchasing teams to place orders for replenishment stock, ensuring timely delivery and availability of inventory items.
	Support inventory and stock management systems, ensuring smooth operation
	Develop and implement effective social media strategies including to create, curate, and manage engaging content across all social media platforms.
	Monitor, listen, and respond to users in a positive and professional manner.Manage social media advertising campaigns to drive targeted traffic and sales.
	Track and report on social media performance and ROI.
	Any other assigned task by the management.


Requirements


	B.Sc / HND / OND in IT related course with minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience.
	Experience supporting Windows environments, POS systems, and networked devices.
	Strong knowledge of computer hardware, software, and troubleshooting methods.
	Good understanding of basic networking (Wi-Fi, routers/switches, IP addressing).
	Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure.
	Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues simply.
	Ability to prioritise tasks in a fast-paced retail environment.
	Previous IT support experience in retail or a similar customer-facing environment.
	Familiarity with retail systems such as POS, back-office stock systems, or handheld scanners.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / month

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: recruitment@dunnandbraxton.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Content Writer",
  "description": "FabWoman is a digital media platform that creates women-focused content.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Writer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Internship

Responsibilities


	Write high-quality, engaging, and original content for the FabWoman platform, including blog posts and articles.
	Conduct thorough research on industry-related topics to ensure content accuracy and relevance, and ensure that facts and data are verified to maintain credibility.
	Implement SEO best practices and keyword research in content to improve search engine rankings and increase organic traffic.
	Keeping up-to-date with industry trends.
	Ensurearticles and blog posts are error-free before publication.
	Attend industry events when necessary.


Skills/Qualifications


	Excellent writing and editing skills
	Knowledge of SEO and content management systems
	Prior experience in writing lifestyle and women-focused contentis a plus.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;info@fabwoman.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-15",

  },

Content Writer Job at FabWoman




        
    

        
        FabWoman is a digital media platform that creates women-focused content.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Writer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Internship

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Write high-quality, engaging, and original content for the FabWoman platform, including blog posts and articles.
	Conduct thorough research on industry-related topics to ensure content accuracy and relevance, and ensure that facts and data are verified to maintain credibility.
	Implement SEO best practices and keyword research in content to improve search engine rankings and increase organic traffic.
	Keeping up-to-date with industry trends.
	Ensurearticles and blog posts are error-free before publication.
	Attend industry events when necessary.


Skills/Qualifications


	Excellent writing and editing skills
	Knowledge of SEO and content management systems
	Prior experience in writing lifestyle and women-focused contentis a plus.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info@fabwoman.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Officer",
  "description": "Devien Consult Limited - Our client is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Our client is urgently seeking a proactive and results-driven Business Development Officer to drive growth, expand client base, and increase revenue.


Job Responsibilties


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and partners
	Develop and implement sales and growth strategies
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis
	Prepare proposals, presentations, and business reports
	Meet and exceed set sales and revenue targets.


Job Requirements


	Proven experience in business development, sales, or a related role
	Strong negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills
	Goal-oriented with a strong drive for results
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively.


Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-08",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-09",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Devien Consult"
    
  },

Business Development Officer Job at Devien Consult Limited




        
    

        
        Devien Consult Limited - Our client is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	Our client is urgently seeking a proactive and results-driven Business Development Officer to drive growth, expand client base, and increase revenue.


Job Responsibilties
     

            
    




	Identify and pursue new business opportunities
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and partners
	Develop and implement sales and growth strategies
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis
	Prepare proposals, presentations, and business reports
	Meet and exceed set sales and revenue targets.


Job Requirements


	Proven experience in business development, sales, or a related role
	Strong negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills
	Goal-oriented with a strong drive for results
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively.


Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Desk Officer / Receptionist",
  "description": "In-Country Medicare Limited is a specialist healthcare and integrative medicine centre based in Abuja, Nigeria, committed to delivering high-quality, patient-centred care. The organization focuses on disease prevention, wellness optimization, chronic disease management, and healthy aging by combining conventional medical practice with evidence-based integrative and functional medicine approaches.

Our services include advanced diagnostic and laboratory support, nutritional IV therapies, oxygen and ozone therapy, electromagnetic field treatments (ONDAMED), DNA testing, pharmacy services, and home-based care. In-Country Medicare Limited is dedicated to reducing medical tourism by providing world-class healthcare solutions locally.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer / Receptionist

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Reports To: CEO, HOD Nursing / System Cordinator

Job Summary


	The Front Desk Officer serves as the first point of contact for clients, patients, and visitors, representing the organization with professionalism, intelligence, and confidence.
	The ideal candidate must be proactive, well-spoken, well-presented, and capable of managing front desk operations efficiently while maintaining a welcoming and polished front office environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet and attend to visitors, clients, and patients courteously and professionally
	Answer, screen, and direct phone calls and electronic communications clearly and confidently
	Schedule, confirm, and manage appointments accurately
	Provide clear, correct information and handle inquiries efficiently
	Maintain accurate records, logs, and front desk documentation
	Coordinate with internal teams to ensure smooth daily operations
	Receive, sort, and distribute mail and official correspondence
	Maintain a neat, organized, and presentable reception area at all times
	Uphold confidentiality, professionalism, and organizational standards
	Perform additional administrative duties as assigned.


Required Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Minimum of [OND / HND / Bachelor&rsquo;s degree] in a relevant field
	3&ndash;5 years of proven experience in a front desk or receptionist role
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision


Core Competencies &amp; Skills:


	Highly intelligent, proactive, and quick-thinking
	Excellent command of spoken and written English
	Soft-spoken, polite, and professional communication style
	Strong interpersonal and customer service skills
	High emotional intelligence and professionalism
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and remain calm under pressure
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).


Personal &amp; Professional Attributes:


	Good character with strong ethical values
	Pleasant, professional, and well-groomed appearance suitable for a front-facing role
	Excellent dress sense aligned with corporate standards
	Friendly, approachable, and confident demeanor
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills:


Professional Expectations:


	Punctuality, reliability, and consistency
	Respect for clients, patients, colleagues, and visitors
	Commitment to excellence, discretion, and service quality.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application letter and updated CV, along with a recent full-length photograph, compiled in one PDF document&nbsp; to:&nbsp;incountrymedicare@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Front Desk Officer&quot; as the subject of the email.",

  },

Front Desk Officer / Receptionist Job at In-Country Medicare Limited




        
    

        
        In-Country Medicare Limited is a specialist healthcare and integrative medicine centre based in Abuja, Nigeria, committed to delivering high-quality, patient-centred care. The organization focuses on disease prevention, wellness optimization, chronic disease management, and healthy aging by combining conventional medical practice with evidence-based integrative and functional medicine approaches.

Our services include advanced diagnostic and laboratory support, nutritional IV therapies, oxygen and ozone therapy, electromagnetic field treatments (ONDAMED), DNA testing, pharmacy services, and home-based care. In-Country Medicare Limited is dedicated to reducing medical tourism by providing world-class healthcare solutions locally.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer / Receptionist

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Reports To: CEO, HOD Nursing / System Cordinator

Job Summary


	The Front Desk Officer serves as the first point of contact for clients, patients, and visitors, representing the organization with professionalism, intelligence, and confidence.
	The ideal candidate must be proactive, well-spoken, well-presented, and capable of managing front desk operations efficiently while maintaining a welcoming and polished front office environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet and attend to visitors, clients, and patients courteously and professionally
	Answer, screen, and direct phone calls and electronic communications clearly and confidently
	Schedule, confirm, and manage appointments accurately
	Provide clear, correct information and handle inquiries efficiently
	Maintain accurate records, logs, and front desk documentation
	Coordinate with internal teams to ensure smooth daily operations
	Receive, sort, and distribute mail and official correspondence
	Maintain a neat, organized, and presentable reception area at all times
	Uphold confidentiality, professionalism, and organizational standards
	Perform additional administrative duties as assigned.


Required Qualifications & Experience


	Minimum of [OND / HND / Bachelor’s degree] in a relevant field
	3–5 years of proven experience in a front desk or receptionist role
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision


Core Competencies & Skills:


	Highly intelligent, proactive, and quick-thinking
	Excellent command of spoken and written English
	Soft-spoken, polite, and professional communication style
	Strong interpersonal and customer service skills
	High emotional intelligence and professionalism
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and remain calm under pressure
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).


Personal & Professional Attributes:


	Good character with strong ethical values
	Pleasant, professional, and well-groomed appearance suitable for a front-facing role
	Excellent dress sense aligned with corporate standards
	Friendly, approachable, and confident demeanor
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills:


Professional Expectations:


	Punctuality, reliability, and consistency
	Respect for clients, patients, colleagues, and visitors
	Commitment to excellence, discretion, and service quality.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application letter and updated CV, along with a recent full-length photograph, compiled in one PDF document  to: incountrymedicare@gmail.com using "Front Desk Officer" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Officer",
  "description": "Rosettee Construction is a construction company that has been incorporated for over three (3) Decades, offering productive and seamless services. We are professionals in Civil Engineering, Steel Structure, Electrical and Mechanical Engineering and we are a KIRBY authorized builder in Nigeria. We specialize in delivering to our clients Turn key Projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Procurement Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Purpose (Summary)


	The Procurement Officer is responsible for sourcing and purchasing construction materials, equipment, and services in line with company requirements.
	The role ensures timely, cost-effective, and quality-driven procurement to support ongoing projects and operational needs.


Key Responsibilities
Sourcing &amp; Vendor Management:


	Source and procure construction materials, equipment, and services according to company needs.
	Identify, assess, and onboard reliable vendors and suppliers, maintaining strong and professional relationships.
	Monitor vendor performance and ensure compliance with quality, delivery, and contractual expectations.


Contracting &amp; Negotiation:


	Negotiate pricing, contracts, and payment terms to secure savings and ensure value for money.
	Review and manage vendor agreements to ensure alignment with company standards.


Procurement Operations:


	Prepare and process purchase orders, requisitions, RFQs, and all related procurement documentation.
	Coordinate directly with project managers, site engineers, and the finance team to ensure smooth and timely procurement operations.
	Track inventory levels and initiate replenishment when required to avoid stock shortages.


Compliance &amp; Documentation:


	Ensure adherence to company procurement policies, internal controls, and regulatory standards.
	Maintain accurate records of all purchases, vendor information, pricing history, and contract terms.


Reporting:


	Provide regular reports on procurement activities, supplier performance, stock updates, and cost analysis.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;admin@rosettee-construction.net&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  },

Procurement Officer Job at Rosettee Construction




        
    

        
        Rosettee Construction is a construction company that has been incorporated for over three (3) Decades, offering productive and seamless services. We are professionals in Civil Engineering, Steel Structure, Electrical and Mechanical Engineering and we are a KIRBY authorized builder in Nigeria. We specialize in delivering to our clients Turn key Projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Purpose (Summary)
     

            
    




	The Procurement Officer is responsible for sourcing and purchasing construction materials, equipment, and services in line with company requirements.
	The role ensures timely, cost-effective, and quality-driven procurement to support ongoing projects and operational needs.


Key Responsibilities
Sourcing & Vendor Management:


	Source and procure construction materials, equipment, and services according to company needs.
	Identify, assess, and onboard reliable vendors and suppliers, maintaining strong and professional relationships.
	Monitor vendor performance and ensure compliance with quality, delivery, and contractual expectations.


Contracting & Negotiation:


	Negotiate pricing, contracts, and payment terms to secure savings and ensure value for money.
	Review and manage vendor agreements to ensure alignment with company standards.


Procurement Operations:


	Prepare and process purchase orders, requisitions, RFQs, and all related procurement documentation.
	Coordinate directly with project managers, site engineers, and the finance team to ensure smooth and timely procurement operations.
	Track inventory levels and initiate replenishment when required to avoid stock shortages.


Compliance & Documentation:


	Ensure adherence to company procurement policies, internal controls, and regulatory standards.
	Maintain accurate records of all purchases, vendor information, pricing history, and contract terms.


Reporting:


	Provide regular reports on procurement activities, supplier performance, stock updates, and cost analysis.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: admin@rosettee-construction.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
